answerText: "Thyrsis"[10] "Thyrsis" was written by this Victorian poet who wrote "Thou waitest for the spark from Heaven" in his poem "The Scholar-Gipsy."
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Virginia + Dartmouth | 3 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This poem's speaker notes how "round me too the night in ever-nearing circle weaves her shade." For 10 points each: [10] Name this poem which instructs the title figure to "let in thy voice a whisper often come, to chase fatigue and fear" reminding him that "still our tree is there!"
